guide.p0: Items section focuses on equipments. Equipments have the biggest impact on your character's attributes and elements.

p1.part1: There are 4 item tiers, from weak to strong: Common, rare, mystic, legendary. Higher item tiers has better base stats and better chance get more bonus stats.
p1.part2: Common and rare items can drop from regular monsters.
p1.part3: Mystic items can drop from dungeons or be crafted by players.
p1.part4: Legendary items only drop from dungeons.

guide.p2: Each weapon has custom 3D model. You can see some of them in 3D view on sketchfab:

weapon.p0: Each class can use multiple weapon type. (2~4 depending on class)
weapon.p1: There are 10 weapon types in Guardians of Adelia.

armor.p0: Each class can use multiple armor type. (2~3 depending on class)
armor.p1: Wearing 4 pieces of same armor type activates a bonus effect. (Helmet, chestplate, leggings, boots)
armor.p2: There are 5 armor types in Guardians of Adelia.
armor.p3: Shield give the same stats as armors but they can also block attacks coming from front.

accessory.p0: Accessories does not require any class.
accessory.p1: There are 5 types of accessories; earrings, necklaces, rings, gloves and parrots. Accessories give bonus attributes and element points at random. Accessory types are identical but they fit into different slots.
accessory.p2: You can equip accessories from RPG Inventory.

enchanting.p0: Enhancing an item is simply upgrading it by adding extra attribute. You can enchant weapons to increase damage, armors and shields to increase maximum health.
enchanting.p1: An enchant stone is required for enchanting. There are 4 levels of enchant stones. Each tier is used for 3 enchantment levels. So 4 x 3, your items can be upgraded to +12 enchantment level.
enchanting.p2: To enhance an item, you need enhancement stones, and a piece of equipment that you wish to enhance. This must be either a weapon, a shield, or a piece of armor. To enhance something you must go to a weapon or armor smith.
